Meijer_, Mar 07 2009This sequence is related to A000326 by a(n) = n*A000326(n)-sum(A000326(i), i=0..n-1) and this is the case d=3 in the identity n*(n*(d*n-d+2)/2)-sum(k*(d*k-d+2)/2, k=0..n-1) = n*(n+1)*(2*d*n-2*d+3)/6. - _Bruno Berselli_, Apr 21 20102*a(n) gives the principal diagonal of the convolution array A213819. - _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 04 2012Partial sums of the figurate octagonal numbers A000567. For each sequence with a linear recurrence with constant coefficients, the values reduced modulo some constant m generate a periodic sequence. For this sequence, these Pisano periods have length 1, 4, 3, 8, 5, 12, 7, 16,  9, 20, 11, 24, 13, 28, 15, 32, 17,.. for m>=1. - _Ant King_, Oct 26 2012
